top_categories.workout_context: Grinduro Canada's mixed terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 67 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Grinduro Canada's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
88ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Grinduro Canada, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Grinduro Canada, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grinduro Canada. Train it until it feels boring.
5,900ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
67 miles on mixed terrain burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
5,900ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed terrain. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Smooth pedaling at 67 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,900ft of climbing on mixed terrain does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grinduro Canada’s 67 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Grinduro Canada demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 67 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 67 miles of mixed terrain in Saint-Urbain-de-Charlevoix, Quebec, Canada.
